metadata.title: CVE-2022-31745 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
[Unknown description]

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-31745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-geckodriver - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '101.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
